workflow.name: Web security scanner for OWASP compliance with Markdown reports
workflow.description:
**How the n8n OWASP Scanner Works & How to Set It Up**

**How It Works (Simple Flow):**
- **1. Input**: Enter target URL + endpoint (e.g., `https://example.com`, `/login`)
- **2. Scan**: This workflow executes 5 parallel HTTP tests (Headers, Cookies, CORS, HTTPS, Methods)
- **3. Analyze**: Pure JS logic checks OWASP ASVS (Application Security Verification Standard) rules (no external tools)
- **4. Merge**: Combines all findings into one Markdown report
- **5. Output**: Auto-generates + downloads `scan-2025-11-16_210900.md`** (example filename)
- **6. Email:** (Optional) Forward the report to an email address using Gmail.

---

**Setup in 3 Steps (2 Minutes)**

1. **Import Workflow**
   - Copy the full JSON (from "Export Final Workflow")
   - In n8n ‚Üí **Workflows** ‚Üí **Import from JSON** ‚Üí Paste ‚Üí Import

2. **(Optional) Connect your Gmail credentials**
   - In the last node to auto-email the report

3. **Click Execute the workflow** 
   - Enter a URL in the new window, then click 'submit'.

*You can alternatively download or receive the Markdown report directly from the Markdown to File node* 

---
  
*(Supports any HTTP/HTTPS endpoint. Works in n8n Cloud or self-hosted.)*

parameters.content:
## Step 1. Configure Gmail (Optional)
**Double click** to edit and configure your credentials to enable reports as well as configure the destination email address.

## n8n OWASP Security Misconfiguration Scanner

## How it works
This workflow performs a non-intrusive security audit of any public URL (typically a login or API endpoint). It sends a few safe and ethical HTTP requests and analyzes:
‚Ä¢ Missing or weak security headers (HSTS, CSP, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Dangerous HTTP methods & CORS misconfiguration
‚Ä¢ Cookie security flags (Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite)
‚Ä¢ HTTPS enforcement and redirect behavior
‚Ä¢ CORS preflight origin reflection
Results are compiled into a Markdown report and optionally emailed.

## Setup steps

Step 1. (Optional) Connect your Gmail credentials in the last node to auto-email the report
Step 2. Click Execute the workflow, or the 'Landing Page URL' and enter a URL in the new window, then click 'submit'.

*You can alternatively download or receive the Markdown report directly from the Markdown to File node*

parameters.message: see attached for details about the target website.
parameters.subject: ={{ $('Create Markdown Report').item.json.summary.scanId }}

parameters.formDescription: Check your website for security vulnerabilities and get a detailed report

parameters.content:
## Reporting Nodes
**Double Click** To view 'Markdown to File' node for a report if Gmail is not configured.

## Step 2. Landing Page URL
**Double click** to start
workflow and enter a 
URL for testing

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
